On 05.01.2009, at 06:26, ramsub4 wrote:

> Creating a composite resource is probably not a good idea as there can
> many combinations of resources. Any ideas?

I don't see why this is a bad idea. What would be the downside of  
creating new resources? I think resources can be created cheaply  
enough so that a generic solution becomes unnecessary in the majority  
of actual use cases. If you start going down the generic route, you  
end up inventing SQL over HTTP GET which I consider a bad idea indeed.

Stefan
